verses.verse: Like snow <S%H7950><s%> in summer <S%H7019><s%> and like rain <S%H4306><s%> in harvest, <S%H7105><s%> So <S%H3651><s%> honor <S%H9202><s%> is not fitting <S%H5000><s%> for a fool. <S%H3684><s%>

Like a sparrow <S%H6833><s%> in [its] flitting, <S%H5110><s%> like a swallow <S%H1866><s%> in [its] flying, <S%H5774><s%> So <S%H3651><s%> a curse <S%H7045><s%> without <S%H2600><s%> cause <S%H2600><s%> does not alight. <S%H935><s%>
A whip <S%H7752><s%> is for the horse, <S%H5483><s%> a bridle <S%H4964><s%> for the donkey, <S%H2543><s%> And a rod <S%H7626><s%> for the back <S%H1460><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
Do not answer <S%H6030><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> according to his folly, <S%H200><s%> Lest <S%H6435><s%> you also <S%H1571><s%> be like <S%H9586><s%> him.
Answer <S%H6030><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> as his folly <S%H200><s%> [deserves], Lest <S%H6435><s%> he be wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own eyes. <S%H5869><s%>

He cuts <S%H7096><s%> off <S%H7096><s%> [his own] feet, <S%H7272><s%> [and] drinks <S%H8354><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> Who sends <S%H7971><s%> a message <S%H1697><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a fool. <S%H3684><s%>
[Like] the legs <S%H7785><s%> [which] hang <S%H1802><s%> down <S%H1802><s%> from the lame, <S%H6455><s%> So is a proverb <S%H4912><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
Like one who binds <S%H9503><s%> a stone <S%H68><s%> in a sling, <S%H4773><s%> So <S%H3651><s%> is he who gives <S%H5414><s%> honor <S%H9202><s%> to a fool. <S%H3684><s%>
[Like] a thorn <S%H2336><s%> [which] falls <S%H5927><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a drunkard, <S%H7910><s%> So is a proverb <S%H4912><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of fools. <S%H3684><s%>
[Like] an archer <S%H7228><s%> who wounds <S%H9123><s%> everyone, <S%H3605><s%> So is he who hires <S%H7936><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> or who hires <S%H7936><s%> those who pass <S%H5674><s%> by.
Like a dog <S%H3611><s%> that returns <S%H7725><s%> to its vomit <S%H6892><s%> Is a fool <S%H3684><s%> who repeats <S%H8138><s%> his folly. <S%H200><s%>
Do you see <S%H7200><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own eyes <S%H5869><s%>? There is more <S%H4480><s%> hope <S%H8615><s%> for a fool <S%H3684><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> for him.
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> says, <S%H559><s%> "There is a lion <S%H7826><s%> in the road! <S%H1870><s%> A lion <S%H738><s%> is in the open <S%H7339><s%> square! <S%H7339><s%>"
[As] the door <S%H1817><s%> turns <S%H5437><s%> on its hinges, <S%H9482><s%> So [does] the sluggard <S%H6102><s%> on his bed. <S%H4296><s%>

The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> buries <S%H2934><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> in the dish; <S%H6747><s%> He is weary <S%H3811><s%> of bringing <S%H7725><s%> it to his mouth <S%H6310><s%> again. <S%H7725><s%>
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> is wiser <S%H2450><s%> in his own eyes <S%H5869><s%> Than <S%H4480><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> men who can give <S%H7725><s%> a discreet <S%H2940><s%> answer. <S%H7725><s%>
[Like] one who takes <S%H2388><s%> a dog <S%H3611><s%> by the ears <S%H241><s%> Is he who passes <S%H5674><s%> by [and] meddles <S%H9378><s%> with strife <S%H7379><s%> not belonging to him.
Like a madman <S%H9231><s%> who throws <S%H3384><s%> Firebrands, <S%H2131><s%> arrows <S%H2671><s%> and death, <S%H4194><s%>
So <S%H3651><s%> is the man <S%H376><s%> who deceives <S%H7411><s%> his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> And says, <S%H559><s%> "Was I not joking <S%H7832><s%>?"

For lack <S%H657><s%> of wood <S%H6086><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%> goes <S%H3518><s%> out, And where there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> whisperer, <S%H7279><s%> contention <S%H4066><s%> quiets <S%H8367><s%> down. <S%H8367><s%>

[Like] charcoal <S%H6352><s%> to hot <S%H1513><s%> embers <S%H1513><s%> and wood <S%H6086><s%> to fire, <S%H784><s%> So is a contentious <S%H4066><s%> man <S%H376><s%> to kindle <S%H2787><s%> strife. <S%H7379><s%>

The words <S%H1697><s%> of a whisperer <S%H7279><s%> are like dainty <S%H3859><s%> morsels, <S%H3859><s%> And they go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> into the innermost <S%H2315><s%> parts <S%H2315><s%> of the body. <S%H990><s%>

[Like] an earthen <S%H2789><s%> vessel <S%H2789><s%> overlaid <S%H6823><s%> with silver <S%H3701><s%> dross <S%H5509><s%> Are burning <S%H1814><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> and a wicked <S%H7451><s%> heart. <S%H3820><s%>
He who hates <S%H8130><s%> disguises <S%H9330><s%> [it] with his lips, <S%H8193><s%> But he lays <S%H7896><s%> up deceit <S%H4820><s%> in his heart. <S%H7130><s%>
When <S%H3588><s%> he speaks <S%H6963><s%> graciously, <S%H2603><s%> do not believe <S%H539><s%> him, For there are seven <S%H7651><s%> abominations <S%H8441><s%> in his heart. <S%H3820><s%>
[Though his] hatred <S%H8135><s%> covers <S%H3680><s%> itself with guile, <S%H4860><s%> His wickedness <S%H9567><s%> will be revealed <S%H1540><s%> before the assembly. <S%H6951><s%>
He who digs <S%H3738><s%> a pit <S%H7845><s%> will fall <S%H5307><s%> into it, And he who rolls <S%H1556><s%> a stone, <S%H68><s%> it will come <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> on him.
A lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> hates <S%H8130><s%> those it crushes, <S%H1790><s%> And a flattering <S%H2509><s%> mouth <S%H6310><s%> works <S%H6213><s%> ruin. <S%H4072><s%>
